item.title: Lucretius' Dance of Atoms
item.description: Lucretius was a Roman poet and philospher born in 94 BC. He wrote a six volume work called De Rerum Natura or On the nature of things, written in dactylic hexameter and known to detail the main tenants of Epicureanism. It’s Book II has this passage in a section known as ‘The Dance of Atoms’. All bodies of matter are in motion. To understand this best, Remember that the atoms do not have a place to rest,
